required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: DERM US and EU Validation Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Clinical Validation Study to Demonstrate the Effectiveness of an Artificial Intelligence Algorithm (DERM) to Identify Skin Cancer in Patients Undergoing a Skin Biopsy

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims establish the effectiveness of Image Analysing Algorithm (DERM) to identify melanoma, Squamous Cell Carcinoma (SCC) and Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC) when used to analyse dermoscopic images of skin lesions within the US and European population.

primary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of DERM to detect "Malignant conditions"
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of DERM to detect Melanoma, SCC and BCC combined

primary_outcome.measure: Specificity of DERM to detect Malignant conditions.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
primary_outcome.description: Specificity of DERM to detect Melanoma, SCC and BCC combined

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of DERM to detect Melanoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of DERM to detect Melanoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of DERM to detect Melanoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of DERM to detect Melanoma

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of DERM to detect Squamous Cell Carcinoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of DERM to correctly classify SCC

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of DERM to detect Squamous Cell Carcinoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of DERM to correctly classify SCC

secondary_outcome.measure: Sensitivity of DERM to detect Basal Cell Carcinoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Sensitivity of DERM to correctly classify BCC

secondary_outcome.measure: Specificity of DERM to detect Basal Cell Carcinoma
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
secondary_outcome.description: Specificity of DERM to correctly classify BCC

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day

other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: AUROC, sensitivity, specificity, positive predictive value (PPV), negative predictive value (NPV) etc. of DERM to detect melanoma, SCC, BCC, premalignant, and benign conditions grouped and individually

other_outcome.measure: Probability that the most probable lesion label DERM returns matches the lesion diagnosis
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Probability that the alternative classification label DERM that returns, matches the lesion diagnosis

other_outcome.measure: The impact of patient characteristics on the diagnostic accuracy of DERM
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Such as sex, age, and Fitzpatrick skin type

other_outcome.measure: The impact of lesions characteristic on the diagnostic accuracy of DERM
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Such as location, size, growth, stage and sub-type

other_outcome.measure: AUROC of DERM to identify malignant conditions for each individual camera / lens type
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: AUROC of DERM to identify malignant conditions for each individual camera / lens type

other_outcome.measure: Concordance of DERM results by each individual camera / lens type
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Concordance of DERM results by each individual camera / lens type

other_outcome.measure: Strength of association between correct classification and acceptance/rejection status of images
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Strength of association between correct classification and acceptance/rejection status of images

other_outcome.measure: AUROC of DERM when macro images are used both to train the algorithm and as test images
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: AUROC of DERM when macro images are used both to train the algorithm and as test images

other_outcome.measure: Correlation between clinician assessment of likelihood of skin cancer with histopathology diagnosis
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Correlation between clinician assessment of likelihood of skin cancer with histopathology diagnosis

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of images taken that are rejected by the IQ check (MoleNotMole + Image Quality), where a second image is successfully taken
other_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, on average of 1 day
other_outcome.description: Percentage of images taken that are rejected by the IQ check (MoleNotMole + Image Quality), where a second image is successfully taken

intervention.intervention_name: Deep Ensemble for the Recognition of Malignancy (DERM)

study_pop.textblock: Patients attending a dermatology clinic with at least one skin lesion that will be biopsied due to a suspicion of skin cancer will be eligible for the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Willing and able to give informed consent for participation in the study,
- Male or Female, aged 18 years or above,
- Have at least one suitable skin lesion that will be biopsied due to a suspicion of skin cancer,
To be suitable for inclusion, a skin lesion must NOT have ANY of the following limitations:
located on an anatomical site of different skin structure: palms of hands or soles of feet (acral lesion), mucosal surfaces (lips and eyes) or under nail (ungal lesion), a diameter greater than the diameter of the dermoscopic lenses, located on an anatomical site unsuitable for photographing, including on surface of genitals and hair-bearing areas, has been previously biopsied, excised, treated or otherwise traumatised, located in an area of visible scarring or tattooing.
- In the Investigator's opinion, able and willing to comply with all study requirements.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any other significant disease or disorder which, in the opinion of the Investigator, may either put the participant at risk because of participation in the study, or may influence the result of the study, or the participant's ability to participate in the study.
